# userActivity

**Instance Property**

An object encapsulating a user activity supported by this responder.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var userActivity: NSUserActivity? { get set }
```

## Discussion

By setting the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder/userActivity] property on a responder, the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivity] object becomes managed by UIKit. User activities managed by UIKit are saved automatically at appropriate times. You can lazily add state data representing the user’s activity using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder/updateUserActivityState(_:)] override. Multiple responders can share a single [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivity] instance, in which case they all get an [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder/updateUserActivityState(_:)] callback.



A responder object can set its [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIResponder/userActivity] property to `nil` if it no longer wants to participate. Any [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivity] objects that are managed by UIKit but which have no associated responders (or documents) are automatically invalidated.

## Supporting user activities

- **restoreUserActivityState(_:)**: Restores the state needed to continue the given user activity.
- **updateUserActivityState(_:)**: Updates the state of the given user activity.
